intro: Secamone dequairei, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
